Ready to take your Salthill business online and reach customers beyond the promenade? Kraft Agency delivers complete e-commerce marketing and development solutions tailored for Salthill businesses. Whether you're a boutique retailer, hospitality business, or service provider looking to sell products online, we have the expertise to build and grow your online store. From stunning Shopify development to strategic advertising campaigns, we handle everything needed to drive online revenue growth.

Our e-commerce approach is designed for Salthill businesses looking to maximize both local and tourist markets. We build beautiful, mobile-optimized online stores that work seamlessly on any device – crucial for capturing tourist sales. Then we drive qualified traffic through multiple channels: Google Shopping ads to capture purchase-intent customers, Facebook and Instagram advertising to build brand awareness, SEO to rank for product searches, and email marketing to turn one-time buyers into loyal customers. Every element is optimized using AI-powered tools to maximize your return on investment.

What makes Kraft Agency perfect for Salthill e-commerce businesses is our understanding of the local market dynamics. We know how to balance serving local Galway customers with attracting tourists and international buyers. We help you manage seasonal fluctuations, optimize for mobile shoppers, and create e-commerce experiences that reflect Salthill's vibrant character while driving serious revenue growth year-round.

faq.question: How can e-commerce help my Salthill business?
faq.answer: E-commerce allows you to reach customers 24/7, sell to tourists before they visit Salthill, capture online searches for products you sell, reduce dependence on seasonal foot traffic, and grow revenue beyond your physical location. Many Salthill businesses see 30-50% revenue growth by adding e-commerce.

faq.question: Can you optimize my store for mobile shoppers?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Mobile optimization is critical for Salthill businesses since many tourists and local shoppers browse on phones. Every store we build is mobile-first, with fast loading, easy navigation, and seamless checkout on smartphones and tablets.

faq.question: How long does it take to launch an online store?
faq.answer: Most Shopify stores launch in 4-6 weeks including design, development, product setup, payment integration, and testing. If you need to launch before tourist season or for a specific event in Salthill, we can work with accelerated timelines.

faq.question: What's the best e-commerce platform for Salthill businesses?
faq.answer: We typically recommend Shopify for most Salthill retail and hospitality businesses due to its ease of use, mobile optimization, reliable hosting, and extensive features. It's perfect for businesses that need to focus on sales rather than technical management.

faq.question: Can you help with international sales and shipping?
faq.answer: Yes! Many Salthill businesses want to sell to international tourists who visit and then order products online. We set up multi-currency support, international shipping options, and localized checkout experiences to make international sales seamless.

faq.question: How much should I invest in e-commerce marketing?
faq.answer: Most successful Salthill e-commerce businesses invest €2,500-€6,000/month in marketing services plus €1,000-€3,000/month in advertising budget. We create custom strategies based on your revenue goals, products, and target markets.

faq.question: Do you offer product photography in Salthill?
faq.answer: Yes! We provide professional product photography services. We can photograph products at our studio, your Salthill location, or even outdoors along the promenade if that suits your brand. High-quality product photos significantly increase e-commerce conversion rates.

faq.question: Can you help manage seasonal fluctuations?
faq.answer: Absolutely! We understand Salthill's seasonal tourism patterns. We help you maximize summer tourist sales while building year-round online revenue through strategic marketing, seasonal campaigns, and customer retention programs that keep sales steady in quieter months.
